title: why i hate top laners... from a junglers perspective
body:
ok first let me say there isn't a player i love more than a good top laner 

but generally this is what happens top lane goes against a strong lane bully ...{{champion:122}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:39}} ... but more so Darius

and they try to duel them in lane... guess what there probably isnt a champion in the game that can take Darius early on in the game... so usually the toplane will die right away and give first blood.... honestly this is like 1/2 of my games... seriously most of the first bloods i see go to the early game lane bully bruisers

well from that point our top lane will tp back in to lane with a {{item:1036}} or  {{item:1028}} think they are the reincarnation of Jesus and jump back into lane like and idiot and die again

well at this point top lane is down 0/2 and behind like 30 cs and he will start pinging the shit out of me to gank when im still lvl 3 and barely clearing wolves(because what happened above occurred in like the first few minutes of the game)... are you kidding me im not touching your lane it would be an  easy double for the enemy... just sit back shut up and hug your damn turret

but no you top laners will continue to feed and type in all chat gg shit jung report mumu 


no you just fed your damn lane and your looking for a scapegoat... im gonna go secure dragon/objectives and gank lanes that will actually yield a positive result 

EDIT: i dont care if you give up a couple kills early but... that 0/2 start turns into 0/6 alot of times... also  dont flame me because I dont camp your lane 

EDIT: keep in mind im talking about what is probably the first 10 or 15 minutes of a game not the entire game

EDIT: ok i get there are counters to Darius just like any champion... I should have said there aren't many Champs that compare to darius in terms of being a tough lane bully... and few meta/viable top laners can handle him in the early game

sincerely, 

                 your ~~reasonable~~  "shit" jungler

replies.body:
I know the feels.

I get the same thing only with Mid laners.

_Mid lane dies once/twice solo to his opponent._
Mid Laner: "You should be ganking this (Insert Champion)"

Holy shit, its not even **5 minutes** or I haven't even finished my first jungle clear to recall back in that **time frame**.

I main mid, and i practice playing with no ganks or blue buff. Not only is it easier for the jungler to do well, but its a crutch (blue buff especially) i can do without.

If you want to gank, or give me blue then by all means. But i try to not ask for it.

Although there are some match ups that cannot be won without ganks you just have to differentiate the crybabies from the rest.

i was playing urgot in mid against a yasuo where i got first blood in 0:49 seconds into game... my team was like omg on skype lol. then my connection shot up and i dc for next 5 mins :P
"URGOT TOO GOOD AGAINST YASUO AT LVL 1{{champion:6}} "

Yeah, I have started that mentality, I usually play Mana hungry champs like Galio and anirva or Orianna, but I have a plan for using them without blue. I do get annoyed however when the enemy is a champ like Zed or Kata (with no resource) AND my jungler is like Zac or something and they still won't give blue, knowing it'll make the game VASTLY better if I had it. But I won't flame, I'll just quietly fume while hugging my turret.

The only time I do actively get annoyed is when the jungler DOES gank, either A when I don't have any mana or hp to help, or B while I am not ready pinging him not to go, and they die, give away blue to the enemy, and then don't come back (or only come back when I am somewhere else proceeding to die again and flaming me for feeding - with 0 deaths)

So many times I have matched my opponent in gold, even if they are 1 kill ahead I'll be ahead in farm, or the other way around, but the jungler gives me no help and then feeds my opponent and flames me, that is ridiculous but very, very common :/

I get that. Personally if i feel if the jungle isn't good enough to gank successfully i just tell them to not show up to my lane unless its to farm while im gone. 

Also fighting against resourceless champs is the worst early game. But i find if you can survive and make it to 1000 gold, you can go back and get either {{item:3114}} + {{item:1056}}  or  {{item:3070}}  or {{item:3028}}  depending on what champ you are and who you're vs. After that their pressure dies down a bit but you also have to learn to manage your mana too :( . Whoever plays a zed or kata (etc.) can freely spam abilities like a 4 year old mashing buttons and get away with it. Unfortunately that's the perks of playing them.  

Idol + dorans works wonders for me :)

This may be only me, but in the interest of smoother team environments, I'd like to say that as a jungler, it comes off pretty negative if you say something like "dont gank my lane".  I'm usually interested in how my laners feel about their (own) matchups, confidence, etc, and will gank based on that, based on how much people scale, and obviously based on where people are positioned in lanes.  

If you don't think you'll need pressure, let your jungler know, but try to do it in a friendly manner, b/c the straight up "dont visit." always makes me feel like w/e lane said that just doesn't want to be a part of the team, and makes me doubt if they will follow up on engages later on etc.

No no, you're 100% right.
 I will usually tell them "not to worry" since I can handle my lane in these cases. Never in a rude way, I always keep things civil. When I'm gone back to base or roaming, I'll tell them to feel free to take farm that will go to waste. Even if my jung isn't ganking I'll let them know when the other jung shows up to gank me so they know where he is at that time. However most of the time my duo partner mains jung so we have an agreement going LOL. 

I'm sorry if I made it seem like I was calling the jungler in a negative way.

{{champion:266}}  *spams pings for assistance while I'm literally still clearing the first camp*
{{champion:122}} FIRST BLOOD
{{champion:266}} "report noc no ganks"
{{champion:56}} {{item:3070}}  (I haven't even upgraded my machete yet, for the love of...)

Actually what makes me more nuts is if any lane completely fails to ward at all, gets ganked repeatedly by their jungler (and they still haven't bought one ward, because hey that trinket has a cooldown), then acts like there's something I'm supposed to do about it. I don't know what it is they expect. I've even asked, What do you want me to do to stop them from ganking from unwarded brush?

Sometimes I ward for them, though. If they still get ganked again and again while that ward's up (because map awareness is your friend), I know I'm in for it.

""""> {{champion:266}}  *spams pings for assistance while I'm literally still clearing the first camp*
> {{champion:122}} FIRST BLOOD
> {{champion:266}} "report noc no ganks"
> {{champion:56}} {{item:3070}}  (I haven't even upgraded my machete yet, for the love of...)""""

but its aatrox...nvm darius still wins unless that aatrox is a challenger smurf

Nawh, as but a humble silver 4 player... You don't need to be a challenger smurf to beat darius as Aatrox.

Max E and fire off lots of poke. It's magic damage and it's taste of darius's own medicine (Darius has a lot of damage in the form of magic damage, so it's hard to go on defense outside of building straight up HP. It's not in the form of poke though.) 

Things to be weary of against darius as aatrox: Ignite. He has just upped the anti on his early cheese factor and is much stronger in a duel against you, however he's still on a ticking timer of "Either I stomp this lane into dust or I start falling off heavily" (Aatrox isn't know for his lategame either, but is way more flexible in teamfights and naturally a better splitpusher... Darius is even more useless if he opted ignite instead of TP/flash)

More than anything, the enemy jungler. He could lose you this lane and may play a bigger factor than darius himself.

The lane explained: You need to realize that you can't really 100-0 him like he can to you. Your strength comes from the poke he doesn't have and the sustain he doesn't have. Weave in and out of trades if you choose to go into a melee brawl that isn't enough to kill him. Be mindful of his pull as it will cancel your Q in mid flight. Disengage early so when he does pull you back, you can still walk away. Your ability to heal back up with W by whacking minions is huge. He has no built in sustain. When darius trades in the middle of a minion wave, which he is likely to do... it shoves the lane toward your tower. He's got nothing but flash for an escape and is an easy gank. You have no reason to push to his tower. Ever. On any champion. If it can be helped, just don't. 

Aatrox is actually listed as a great counter to darius and it's true. As with most counters, it isn't a {{champion:86}} -teed win.

I don't get why {{champion:266}} is listed as a counter to {{champion:122}}, that lane seems pretty strongly in darius's favor sure as you mentioned it's possible for aatrox to win if he plays smart. But even with his ult up he still loses trades to Darius.

I think that's the . Here. If your aatrox and you don't make use of that sweet poke you are wasting your kit. The laneing consist of more then the trades and the brawls. I won't go in a brawl with a Darius if I haven't poked him for days. Darius is a very strong fighter in all ins. Same with voli. Riven can poke him down but when riven overextended or makes a mistakes voli brings down the hammer and beats the bitch like  ther is no tomorrow.

Exactly (Voli -> QEW that over extended Riven)
{{champion:106}} : "What? You didn't see that coming?"

Exactly! Or nice stuff like: Voli low. Riven 50% health. Trying to push turret. Wit till minions almost gone q flash e w :D a lot of people are shocked how fast you would die under folks Thunder dick and a turret

I have to agree. There are much harder counters out there. Most mages  would probably have to think a lot less than Aatrox does in this lane.

A smart darius is going to build {{item:3075}}  as a first item, also. This makes trading with him through auto attacks much riskier, especially if you went for a {{item:3153}} So much so, that even as approaching the mid game... Darius is thriving off the raw power of his kit and doesnt need more AD from items to be effective.

Can't stress how much a good gank from the enemy jungler can offset the intricacies to this matchup, either.

Aatrox can hold his own and even come out on top.... but don't expect to just unlock him and be a Darius counter right off the bat.

I've played a lot of top, and because of that I know that my duties are to (in order)
-Not feed
-Farm
-TP into bot lane and drag fights when needed

Nowhere in there is 
-Kill enemy laner

When I'm playing Sion vs Darius/Vlad/similar tops I know that my focus is not going to be on killing them. Some people think that "winning lane" only means "getting more kills on them than they did on you." But if I go 0-2 in that matchup but come out of lane with 30+ more cs, more teamfight presence, and more impact with tps, I have done my job as the top.

Also, although this is less of a thing in solo queue than it is in LCS, tops usually don't get as much jungle pressure as mid or bot.  Why? Not only does the top benefit from farm more than anything else, but they're also the furthest away from dragon, an important early-mid game objective. 

My advice to any top laner: learn to survive and keep your farm up without any help from anyone. Sure, ganks for top can be impactful and they are pretty nice, but the whole "top is an island " is a thing for a reason. And it's also why you take TP.

People like in OPs post just need to learn that they're not the freaking mid laner.

>Nowhere in there is
-Kill enemy laner

{{champion:92}} I'm
{{champion:84}} not
{{champion:105}} So
{{champion:114}} Sure
{{champion:238}} about
{{champion:133}} That. (well... I actually kill mid laner. . .)

True. But I still think the first three are still more important even for them.

Also I freaking love Quinn top.

I wouldn't gank a Darius that was 2/0 with over thirty CS more than his laning opponent either.

Because I play Darius fairly often. What you think is a "gank", the Darius player sees as a "double kill", in most cases. Darius has legitimately 1v2 potential if he gets ahead.
The time syndra was op i often times just pressed r on the lee sin who thought he was about to gank.. and then i got more fed :P

people don't realize this surprisingly often with bruisers (so pretty much every top laner), my personal favorites being {{champion:31}} and {{champion:1}}.  yes I play bruiser top annie, don't judge me its good I swear

To be fair with the Darius example... if the person is melee then there's shit all they can do about it since Darius will just sit in their minion wave and dare them to try and cs and if they do proceed to shove his axe straight up their rear end. And I hear so often people say "Darius is easy to deal with because he's so easy to gank" well yes, but the jungler needs to gank him, and other lanes may be more prime for ganking, and the other issue is the jungler needs to KEEP ganking top if their top laner is a tank because they're never going to be able to deal with him.

As much flak as CertainlyT gets for his creations, his first one is still his worst, in my opinion.

There is no way that Darius could possibly be worse than the abomination known as Kalista.

Both are cancer to deal with as melees, but at least Darius doesn't make the game unfun for your team as well the way Kalista does.

Darius is worse simply because his playstyle is so binary. Are you ranged? Congrats, the person playing Darius isn't going to have any fun. Are you melee? Sorry, you're not having any fun. Kalista is unfun to play against if she gets ahead, Darius is unfun to play against just by going into the same lane as him.
Oh he was talking about Top Lane. Play against a good Darius laner and it could make you cry with The lack of options you have, with his bleed damage and slow. He is the AD assassin.
its ok, i never ping when im top, if i lose tower, i lose tower. More farm for me when they come to my tier 2.

Coming from a top laner AND jungler, (my 2 best roles) I don't expect you to gank, but if you do, PLEASE for the love of god, take into account that there are 2 types of top champs that you need to pay attention to. 
1: the snowbally/late game monster champ. This includes champs like riven or nasus. The top laner needs to keep them down, and if they are fed or stacked, don't gank, it's no worth. 
2: the 2v1 top champ. This includes rumble, darius, my favorite, mordekaiser. These types can 2v1 the opposing top laner and jungler. This is not the normal gank, you need to be careful and aware of their cool downs. If a Darius's ult is up, try not to take a ton of damage and get dunked, this goes for both roles. Darius is slow, take advantage of that. 
To end my opinion, top lane is an island. Don't expect a gank. But junglers should be aware of what type of top laner the enemy is. They can just let a nasus stack up and overpower your teammate. If the top laner gets camped, put pressure down bot and get dragon. Don't just let your teammate's pressure up top on the nasus that needs camping go to waste.

just keep in mind that once in a while their enemy laner will be sitting in lane with next to no health and could easily be had for a kill.
usually this is when people die, they get really greedy and go for it when they realize they aren't going to receive a gank.

i didnt say i dont gank in general  i said i dont gank if you chain feed your lane early i'll gladly help you secure a kill but im not gonna dive into the Darius who has an {{item:3074}} or a{{item:3143}} before im level 4.

Dari can get Hydra or Randuin before you get lev 4, only if you were afk for 10 mins. Each one (Randuin or Hydra) costs about 3k - player need to 100% cs for 10 mins to get 3k gold. If you're going agressive or your laner is agressive , that means you will miss a lot cs. So your words is just not truth.
ok I over exaggerated but my point still stands XD
So many of my jungle games in low bronze, before I even get to raptors or Red buff the score is 0-3 or 3-0, one way or the other.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WKSiKVJcd5o
This pretty much sums up top laners for you.
I hate it when any lane (not just top) requests a large gank when they see that you're low on mana, health, or both.

I hate it when people come in to gank for me when I'm sitting on 1/6 of my health bar under my turret and the enemy is a good deal on the other side of the lane. Sometimes, you gotta realize you got there too late. =_=

I want to say you're wrong, as I'm a top main, but it seems that whenever someone goes top besides me this is the sort of thing that happens. I've gone from 0/3 to helping carry because I know how to play safe, build properly, pick my spots, and find other ways to make myself useful to my team. But if I'm in a ranked match, and top lane goes 0/3, I'm just thinking "gg" at that point.

Though that's also just bronze in general. If I had a penny for every time I saw someone try to duel someone levels ahead of them who they probably wouldn't win against even if all things were equal, I'd be richer than Bill Gates. Lately, Saturday and Sunday have been Support Saturday and Sunday for me and so I've seen more of this than usual. Like the uber-fed Xin Zhao comes in for a gank, getting spotted by our ward beforehand. I'm Nautilus, and blow every last bit of my CC on him to give Ashe a chance of escaping. She proceeds to stand still, trying to 1v2 the ADC and support further up lane, before taking my immobilizing of Xin as the go-ahead to fight him with his ADC and support literally right behind him. And _I_ was the one who was "fail." "Fail supp."

That's honestly the worst feeling, sacrificing yourself to save your team, only for them to go back in and die along with you.

Part one: feeding lane bullies. Yea, pretty much, I do that all the time.
Part two: going back thinking you're Jesus. Nope, I'm just bad and get dived at level 3.
Part three: pinging like crazy and flaming. I never flame, but I cri evertim.
http://www.quickmeme.com/img/d8/d8a5daf5dee218f0602f75d2d33bff8af83d0ce25cf92c878bd9bf440830eac5.jpg
i was playing jungle voli the other day and i had a nasus top....he gave 5 kills with in 10 mins then bitches about how i didnt gank. Even though he died twice when i was finishing my 3rd camp

I'm with you on this one honestly.

I've had people give over 3 kills before the 10 minute mark.

"GG no ganks"

....Seriously?

Doesn't really matter if top feeds tbh, top can't carry anything

You shouldn't be ganking top lane ever

Just camp mid and bot 24/7

Was bullied by Dari. Was losing like 50 cs. Jungler came and gave him FB. Next gank was succesful, and I killed Dari. Finished game with 13-5 score. So you're wrong. Top can carry and comeback. 

This depends on pick - jungler must babysit lane with champion that can carry game.
I love ganking for Nasus, whither makes it easy to secure the kill and Nasus gets absolutely stupid late game if he's ahead in lane.

I've been spamming {{champion:121}} lately. I'm not going in for a gank on someone like {{champion:122}} or {{champion:92}} or anyone else that has crazy mobility or early game damage so that we end up both dying. Unless they are already really low otherwise play safe and ward your lane so I can stay closer to dragon and bot lane where I have to worry about 2 players feeding.

its your fault if top lose, spam elise this month and i start bot side, then go gnat top after red and scutler should be level 4 should be free kill most of the time unless your top is vlad... then you just camp top over and over an over. i made a lb rq mid after i carried that stupid nida that cried over no lb ban as  abitch. while i killed renekton between his tower so he never got to lane then h bought mobs and mana crystal and start deep.  Dimond 3 for your information and tune. i played on a  na acc in plat 3 and hell i carry games with ap rengar there on acc with shitt teir runes. thats how shift na server is. 

I HATE you junglers that think your solo purpose is ark farming the jungle and that minion control, map pressure, warding, vision denial, ganking, objective control is just some bonous that the laner should be kissing your as and frets for doing. JUNLGERS TAHT AFK IN THE JUNGLE IS AS BAD AS LANERS AFK AT FOUNTAIN
what part of  "im gonna go secure dragon/objectives and gank lanes that will actually yield a positive result" did you not understand?

oo that stuff got forgotten in my anus where it belongs, but you have to everything and be able to gank all lanes, farm the jugnle hard have 3 wards on the map constantly while sweep should always on cd while you take every dragon at the exakt moment it spawn, the first on minute 5. If not so, then you can call riot and beg them yo demote you to brown 5 where you belong

What are you even talking about? 

Like, I'm half-curious because you sound serious yet those expectations are so far away from any sort of reality that it can't be any kind of sober thought. It also doesn't help that English doesn't seem to be your native language, understandably given your region, so that's causing more problems.
Don't bother. have you even seen his username? He can't be more than 2 weeks old as an account, this is a cut and dry shiatpost sockpuppet account.
